Kate's Hall of Miscellany

a gallery of projects and other oddities

Here’s what I’ve been working on lately:

How to make the tiniest HTTP server using Node.js, a fun exercise I did as I was learning how different pieces fit together in web development.

Some notes and Js calculators, a work in progress to accompany the reading of Theory and Technique of Electronic Music by Miller Puckette.

And here are some older projects:

Analysis of Weather Data, where I cut my teeth on using Python for data analysis and visualization.

My ‘recipe blog’, where I have made a mess trying my hand at some more complicated web development. Also there are cute plant pictures. Also I have yet to actually put any recipes up.
